intro: Oxymeris congestiflora, commonly known as the clustered oxymeris, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. Its leaves are typically elliptical and arranged in whorls around the stems. Oxymeris congestiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and swampy areas.
